text: The ampere or amp (Symbol: A) is the standard unit of electric current. An electric current of one amp is one coulomb per second. The amp is named after André-Marie Ampère who studied electromagnetism. AMP is a unit magnetic pull, meaning that isn't a unit of power. The ampere is defined so the elementary charge e is 1.602 176 634 × 10−19 C or A•s. == References == == Other websites == * The NIST Reference on Constants, Units, and Uncertainty * A short history of the SI units in electricity Category:SI units
title: Ampere
